item.description:
Earth Day at Garden In The Woods
Occurs at: Garden In The Woods: New England Wild Flower Society
Location: 180 Hemenway Road, Framingham, MA directions
Phone: 508-877-7630
Date: Saturday, April 26, 2008
Hours: 12:00 to 4:00 pm
Ages: Toddlers, Kids
In/Outdoor: Outdoor
Cost: Free

!!!! Please bring a picnic. We can all have lunch together and chat. !!!!

Don't miss a minute of spring at Garden in the Woods, with guided tours every half hour of the magnificent garden filled with newly emerging spring wildflowers and ferns.

Meet MOTHER NATURE and learn to juggle as she does.
Come early to get a seat at ANIMAL AMBASSADORS live animal shows, and Earth Day storytelling programs.
At noon learn the story of a beloved but despised dandelion with "The Teeth of the Lion" told by author Anita Sanchez.
Live animal programs feature exciting creatures including alligators, boa constrictors, chinchillas, and more!

Enjoy FREE face painting, and start your own native plant garden, a wildflower seed planting activity, with the help of friendly gardeners sharing earth-saving advice throughout the day.

Admission and programs are FREE; seats for shows are on a first-come basis. Rain or shine.
item.why: Let's have some outdoor fun. If raining, we can go to Chuck E. Cheese instead.

group.name: Families with Russian Kids, Moms Club, Playgroups

item.name: Playdate @ Earth Day at Garden In The Woods
